intro: Lepyrodia valliculae, commonly known as the mountain lepidothamnus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it forms dense, low-growing mats. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh climatic conditions. Lepyrodia valliculae is known for its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months.
